title: Ping Fluctuations. I have tried everything. Will gift the person who can solve it. Pls help.
body: Around the first of September my ping went from 43 every game to fluctuating from 80's to 300's. I have no idea what changed or why this is happening but i've tried everything i know and read on existing boards. If anyone has advice that will work i'll gift them RP or whatever the fuck they want. I just want to get this fixed. Can anyone help?

replies.body:
Hello fellow summoner! 
I recommend heading over to the Connection Troubleshooting Log Reader. There, you can submit the Network logs from your match(es) and the log reader will show if you were having ping spikes and packet loss and provide solutions.

You can also narrow down the source of high latency or packet loss by downloading the WinMTR Network Diagnostic Tool, then use that to run a traceroute (for 5-15 minutes) to your server's IP found on the Network Guide. You can run tracerts and pings manually, but an MTR gets it over a duration which will catch and display intermittent issues easier.

Hope that helps! If you still have trouble then just browse the forums in the upper left search bar and you'll find tons of great posts on how to figure out/ fix your problem. 

See you on the rift summoner! (haha save your rp to gift a friend for the holiday season!)

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743-Connection-Troubleshooting-Log-Reader (Log reader)

So bye league :{

Inconsistencies in latency (ping) can be caused by a handful of issues, but it's a direct sign that *something* between your PC and our servers is a bit fucky. I'm not sure if you've already tried it, but our [connection guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) offers a list of solutions to ensure your network is talking to the League servers correctly. If you should still encounter issues after taking those steps, we can take a look at your network routing together.

Let me know.
